New Records: Armenia defeated Latvia 4-1 in the UEFA Nations League match, marking a significant win for Armenia.
Key Match Events: Eduard Spertsyan scored the fourth goal of the game in favor of Armenia thanks to a right-footed shot that could not be contained by the opposing goalkeeper.
Lucas Zelaray√°n shot a right-footed shot very close to the visitors' goal to score Armenia's third of the match.
Georgi Harutyunyan scored an own goal and Latvia managed to tie the game unexpectedly.
Vahan Bichakhchyan opened the account for Armenia, after a powerful left-footed shot impossible for the visiting goalkeeper to save.
Pre-Game Insights: The home team, ranked 97th in the FIFA ranking, is in a bad moment of form with only 1 win in their last 10 matches between official and friendly matches.

The away side, ranked 137th in the world, also in a not too positive form but with the precedent of almost a year ago when they won at home the Armenian team by 2-0 in a duel that is remembered of a lot of action where the accuracy in front of goal was key.
Post-Match Reflections: Armenia defeated Latvia 4-1 to take all three points in their quest to win the group.
Armenia's national team has shown a variable performance in the Euro 2024 qualifiers, achieving important victories, but also faced defeats in key matches.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in the Republican Stadium Vazgen Sargsyan in Yerevan, Armenia.
The stadium was opened in 1938 and is usually used to host soccer matches, as the Armenian national team plays its home matches at the stadium.
Others: The match will be broadcasted on Disney+.
Kristers Tobers is a Latvian footballer who plays as a defensive midfielder or central defender and is considered one of the most promising young talents in Latvian soccer.
